column4: Okay... well I just tried to disable a service using update-rc.d
and saw "Do NOT use update-rc.d for this purpose in the docs"
Jon--: that will persist after reboot?
hold up one sec let me read some stuff
sudo update-rc.d servicename stop 2 3 4 5    or what ever runlevels you want
okay, so 'stop' is the level to disable the service?
the levels control which runlevels you want to disable it on 1-6
okay, it looks like there are links for apache2 in rc0, rc1  and rc6.. should I remove those?
0 is for shutdown phase 1 is for recovery console and 6 is for reboot
so if you want.  That's the only time it would get called is shutdown reboot or recovery
right, I'm thinking I don't need a web server that starts on shutdown...
something else that confused me is that mysql was installed and presumably added to startup, but I don't see links in the rc folders...
